Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 121.
Subjects: evils of the time; advice, to princes; counsel, moral; political poems; virtues; satire
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Magdalene College Pepys 2553, p. 187: not in this MS.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Rammeshorne’ — seven 8-line stanzas including refrain, ‘As ryȝth as a rams horne’ or ‘A resoun of the Rammeshorne’

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Thus Ryght wysnes do now procedeAnd sytyht lyke A gay
                    empreceLaw hath lorn All maner of medeAnt settyht vp treuth als
                    hyȝe as god is …
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…Thus be we gouerned for soth as I gesseConueyed by
                    lyn
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 30-2; 421-4; 598.

Bod686.First Lines:
Al rightwesnesse doth now procedeSitte crowned lich an
                    Emperesse…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…þus eche estate is gouerned in sothnesseConueyed by lyue
                    right as arammes horne
Bod686.Attributed Title:
Here … begynneþ a tretis of þe rammeshorne (f.
                        190v); Here endeth a sotil compiled reson of þe Crabbe
                        (191v)

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
All ryghtwysnes now dothe procedesytte crownede lyke an
                    emperesse…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…thus eche astate ys governed in sothenesconveyed by lyne
                    ryght as a rammes horne
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author:
quod Iohn ludgate / writen out of Mstr Philyppes boke (below last line, f.
                        10v) by scribe (John Stow)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
quod Iohn ludgate / writen out of Mstr Philyppes boke (below last line, f.
                        10v) by scribe (John Stow)

BLHar172.First Lines:
Alle ryghtwysnes now dothe procedeSytte crownede lyke an
                    emperesse…
BLHar172.Last Lines:
…Thus eche astate ys gouernede in sothenesconveyed by lyne
                    ryght as a rammes horn
BLHar172.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 171-3.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
…Ipocrise chaunged hath his weedeTaken anabite of vertuous
                    gladnesse…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Thus eche astate is gouerned in sothnesseConueyed by lyne
                    right as a Rammeshorn

BLHar4011.First Lines:
All riȝtwisnes doþe now procedeSittith crownyd like an
                    emperesse…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…Þus eche estate is gouernyd yn soþefastnesconveyed
                    by lyne riȝt as a rammes horne
BLHar4011.Attributed Author:
By lydgate (in rubric above first line, by scribe, f.
                    1ra)

Banna.First Lines:
All rychtous thing the quhilk dois now proceidIs crownit lyk vnto
                    an emperess…
Banna.Last Lines:
…and every stait is gouernit as I gessAls leill by lyne rycht
                    as a rammis horne

HunEL26A13.First Lines:
Al right wisnesse dothe now procedeSitte crowned liche an
                    Emperesse…
HunEL26A13.Last Lines:
…Thus eche astate is gouerned yn sothenesseConueied be lyne
                    right as a rammeshorne
